com.ojcoleman.europa.util

Class IntervalDouble

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.ojcoleman.europa.util.Interval<java.lang.Double>
      • com.ojcoleman.europa.util.IntervalDouble

  • public class IntervalDouble
extends Interval<java.lang.Double>
    Represents a floating-point numeric interval from a minimum to maximum value, [start, end].
    Author:
    O. J. Coleman

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static IntervalDouble UNIT
      The unit interval [0, 1].

      java.lang.Double clamp(java.lang.Double v)

      boolean isIn(java.lang.Double value)
      Determine if the given value lies within this interval.
      java.lang.Double random(java.util.Random random)
      Get a random uniformly distributed value in the range [start, end] (inclusive).
      java.lang.Double range()
      Returns the range of this Interval: end - start.

      Translate a value from the unit interval [0, 1] to the corresponding value from this interval.

      • clamp

        public java.lang.Double clamp(java.lang.Double v)
        Description copied from class: Interval
        If the given value is less than the start of this interval then returns the start value. If the given value is greater than the end of this interval then returns the end value. Otherwise returns the given value.
        Specified by:
        clamp in class Interval<java.lang.Double>
